issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

fields.summary: Deleting Load Balancer That Spans Multiple AZs (clusters) Fails to Delete the Associated Autoscaling Group

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
*Assessment*

If a multi-cluster cloud has one availability zone in a NOTREADY state, when a ELB is launched that covers both availability zones, it will launch the autoscaling group to the ENABLED cluster (i.e. 2 instances will show up).  Is this the expected behavior?

*Signs*

When the LBs are running:
{code}
[root@odc-c-06 ~]# euscale-describe-auto-scaling-groups --region eucalyptus-admin@
AUTO-SCALING-GROUP	asg-euca-internal-elb-735723906303-Hermitage	lc-euca-internal-elb-735723906303-Hermitage-45052e4e	Exodus,Legend		2	2	2	Default

*Steps*

* Setup Eucalyptus 3.4 cloud with multiple clusters (AZs)
* Set one of the clusters to NOTREADY
* Deploy ELB that spans both clusters
* Observe how the Autoscaling group is deployed

*Workaround*

N/A
fields.summary: Multi-AZ ELB deploys autoscaling group on one AZ
fields.environment:
*non-HA*
** 1 x CLC/Walrus
** 2 x CC/SC (for each cluster)
** 1 x NC per cluster
{code}

comments.body: Question here regarding implementation - do we check to see if the clusters are ENABLED before launching the ELB?  If so, couldn't we add in a check to update the autoscaling group (maybe an internal Eucalyptus cloudwatch type metric?) that would scale out, scale based upon the state of the clusters? Looking at the [ELB design docs|https://github.com/eucalyptus/architecture/wiki/elb-3.3-elb-design], it doesn't mention what happens in detail when ELB is launched and terminated with regards to its relationship to AutoScaling, so I was making a guess here.

[~sjones] Is it the expected behavior that if an autoscaling group is given 2 AZs and only one is ENABLED, then all instances up to the desired capacity will be deployed onto the ENABLED AZ? Can we create an ASG when a given AZ is not ENABLED? What happens if faulty zone becomes ENABLED later?

[~spark], yes it is the expected behavior. When the other zone is available instances will be rebalanced, as with AWS/AutoScaling this can result in temporarily exceeding the desired/maximum capacity for the group.

{quote}
AZRebalance

    Balances the number of EC2 instances in the group across the Availability Zones in the region. If you remove an Availability Zone from your Auto Scaling group or an Availability Zone otherwise becomes unhealthy or unavailable, Auto Scaling launches new instances in an unaffected Availability Zone before terminating the unhealthy or unavailable instances. When the unhealthy Availability Zone returns to a healthy state, Auto Scaling automatically redistributes the instances evenly across the Availability Zones for the group.

    Note that if you suspend AZRebalance and a scale out or scale in event occurs, Auto Scaling still tries to balance the Availability Zones. For example, during scale out, Auto Scaling launches the instance in the Availability Zone with the fewest instances.

    If you suspend Launch, AZRebalance neither launches new instances nor terminates existing instances. This is because AZRebalance terminates instances only after launching the replacement instances. If you suspend Terminate, your Auto Scaling group can grow up to ten percent larger than its maximum size, because Auto Scaling allows this temporarily during rebalancing activities. If Auto Scaling cannot terminate instances, your Auto Scaling group could remain above its maximum size until you resume the Terminate process.
{quote}

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AutoScaling/latest/DeveloperGuide/US_SuspendResume.html
Autoscaling group for ELB VM will handle rebalancing when the AZ becomes available.
